author: TingLiu6
body: Could you please help to review?

comments.author: vors
comments.body:
Hi @TingLiu6 . We recently merged a change that requires all tests to be tagged. Please, pick the appropriate tag CI, Feature, Scenario, or Slow.

https://ci.appveyor.com/project/PowerShell/powershell/build/0.6.0.4020#L41
Done, thanks!

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
@lzybkr , The reason for that is that we need to catch the exceptions which won’t happen unless we take this approach.
Changing to not use `[powershell]::Create()` will affect most of this test, so I will finish reviewing after that change has been made.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: Your understanding of `[powershell]::Create()` doesn't apply to this test.  Please make the change, this introduces a difficult to debug and inefficient pattern that we don't want in our tests.

comments.author: TingLiu6
comments.body: @lzybkr ， thanks for your reply, I have fixed the issue, please help to review again.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: Thanks - I provided a bit more feedback.  Fix those 2 issues, squash the commits, and this looks pretty good.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: Looks great - can you squash the commits then I'll merge.

title: Add Pester Test for ParameterBindingTests2.cs
